articles.description: The Consumer Price Index, a measure of inflation, is up 6.2% from a year ago. Still, getting a raise under 6% doesn't always mean you're taking a pay cut.
articles.content:
A worker helps a customer at the Presidente Supermarket in Miami on April 13, 2020.
Workers across the U.S. are wondering how rising inflation might be impacting their take-home pay.
